results.title: Concrete poetry
results.brief_description: Presents , against an interpretive visual and musical background, several works selected from an anthology of concrete poetry compiled by Emmett Williams, in order to demonstrate a new poetic form. The poets include: Ronaldo Azeredo, Carlo Belloli, Claus Bremer, Bob Cobbing, Ian Hamilton Finlay, Oecio pignatori, and Emmett Williams.

results.title: The Land: the South Pembrokeshire coast
results.creator_credit: Richard Guinea, Julia Spark and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: This film concentrates on the main features of the coastal landscape of the south Pembrokeshire coast of southwestern Wales, showing how the two different rock types: old red sandstone and carboniferous limestone, have reacted to the erosive forces of wind, wave and weather. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Land: South Lancashire coast
results.creator_credit: Richard Guinea, Julia Spark and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows how man has adapted the south Lancashire coastline to meet the needs of work and recreation. The large industrial dockland complex of Liverpool shows how man has completely altered the coastal environment in order to satisfy his economic needs. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Snowdonia
results.creator_credit: Richard Guinea, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Combines ground and serial photography with diagrams to explain the formation of glacial features which characterize the landscape of Snowdonia National Park in northwestern Wales. Shows the results of slate mining and discusses conflict between preservation and electrical development and tourism.

results.title: Don't knock the ox
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The International Ox Pull, highlight of the Bridgewater, Nova Scotia, annual fair, is a holdover from the pioneer past when oxen cleared the land and tilled the soil. That these great beasts of burden have lost none of their pulling power is well demonstrated as they drag tons of weight loaded on sleds (the winner pulls up to six tons). Competing teams come from various parts of the Maritimes and the northeastern United States.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: What do drugs do?
results.creator_credit: Mendelson Film Productions and Multi-Media Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the good and bad actions of drugs and chemicals on the body, the risks associated with drugs and the dangers of drug abuse. Emphasises that drugs should be respected both for their beneficial qualities and for their potential harm. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Puffins, predators and pirates
results.creator_credit: Nancy Archibald and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The picturesque biological study gives striking evidence of how as order can be a threat to an entire different species: in this case the relatively rare North Atlantic Penguin. High multiplication rate of herring gulls forces them to attack penguins homeward-bound from fishing trips to rob them of their catch.
results.description: The picturesque biological study gives striking evidence of how as order can be a threat to an entire different species: in this case the relatively rare North Atlantic Penguin. results.title: If the fergi fits, wear it
results.creator_credit: Dan Gomez, John Cosgrove and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Presents the story of the first business venture by a teenage brother and sister who decide to sell silk-screened T-shirts. Shows some of the responsibilities and advantages of going into business. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Responsibility: what limits? ('Those Callaways')
results.brief_description: Excerpt from the 1964 film “Those Calloways”. Presents a story about a man whose private dream of establishing a bird sanctuary interferes with commercial development of a hunting resort. Shows the conflict that arises when he takes the law into his own hands.

results.title: Manioc bread
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indians of the Orinoco: the Makiritare”.
Shows Makiritare women making bread from manioc roots. First they remove the poison by squeezing the shredded roots in enormous basket-tubes. From the flour they make yucca or cassava bread, a dietary staple. The bread is toasted on a flat piece of iron and tossed onto a roof to dry. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
